content:
# I've successfully harvested 20 stone from the new stone patch, and my inventory now includes 20 stone, 30 iron ore, and 10 coal.
# With these resources, I can now proceed to craft the stone furnaces necessary for smelting.

# I need to craft two stone furnaces since I plan to smelt both iron ore and stone into iron plates and stone bricks, respectively.
craft_item(stone_furnace_prototype, quantity=2)
print("Crafted 2 stone furnaces.")

# Next, I will check my inventory to confirm that the furnaces have been crafted successfully.
print(f"Updated inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Now, I will place the first stone furnace at a suitable location, starting with coordinates (0, 0).
first_furnace = place_entity(stone_furnace_prototype, position=Position(x=0, y=0))
print(f"Placed first stone furnace at: {first_furnace.position}")

# I will now place the second stone furnace next to the first one at (1, 0).
second_furnace = place_entity_next_to(stone_furnace_prototype, reference_position=first_furnace.position, direction=Direction.RIGHT)
print(f"Placed second stone furnace at: {second_furnace.position}")

# After placing the furnaces, I will insert coal into each furnace to fuel them.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, first_furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert fuel into the first furnace
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, second_furnace, quantity=5) # Insert fuel into the second furnace

# Now I will insert iron ore into the first furnace to begin the smelting process into iron plates.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, first_furnace, quantity=10)  

print(f"Iron ore has been inserted into the furnaces for smelting into iron plates.")
